Description: Lower body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery globular aryballos; exterior: black-figure decoration (fired brown) consisting of hoplites marching right (legs of three soldiers and part of one shield remaining) with hailstorm filling ornament; below, eight bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.1298, which, according to Venit, may be by the same hand.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 218)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 61, no. A33, pl. XXLVI)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.132) (Phase 1)
